title: Kirill's Miscellaneous Functions
text: collection useful functions found anywhere else.

title: Kirill's Miscellaneous Functions
text: can install development version kimisc GitHub :

title: Replaces NA values — coalesce.na-deprecated
text: (vectorized) function returns first non-NA argument, similar SQL function COALESCE. vector matrix passed first argument, remaining arguments recycled generate vector/matrix dimension, coalescing done element element.

title: Replaces NA values — coalesce.na-deprecated
text: x first value coalesce. ... values coalesce.

title: Replaces NA values — coalesce.na-deprecated
text: vector length x.

title: Replaces NA values — coalesce.na-deprecated
code: coalesce.na(NA, -1) #> `coalesce.na()` is deprecated, use `dplyr::coalesce()` instead. #> [1] -1 coalesce.na(5, 3) #> [1] 5 coalesce.na(c(1, NA, NA), c(NA, 2)) #> Warning: object length is not a multiple of first object length #> [1]  1  2 NA coalesce.na(matrix(c(NA, 1:3), nrow = 2)) #>      [,1] [,2] #> [1,]   NA    2 #> [2,]    1    3 coalesce.na(NA) #> [1] NA

what: Convert Numeric to Factor, with custom formatting — cut_format
title: Convert Numeric to Factor, with custom formatting — cut_format
text: enhanced version base::cut() allows custom formatting applied values.

title: Convert Numeric to Factor, with custom formatting — cut_format
code: cut_format(   x,   breaks,   include.lowest = FALSE,   right = TRUE,   ordered_result = FALSE,   ...,   format_fun = format,   sep = ", ",   paren = c("(", "[", ")", "]") )

title: Convert Numeric to Factor, with custom formatting — cut_format
text: x numeric vector converted factor cutting. breaks [numeric] vector two unique cut points include.lowest logical, indicating ‘x[]’ equal     lowest (highest, right = FALSE) ‘breaks’     value included. right logical, indicating intervals closed     right (open left) vice versa. ordered_result logical: result ordered factor? ... Passed cut() format_fun [function(x): character] vectorized function performs desired formatting.  Default: base::format() sep [character(1)] separator lower upper end interval. Default: ", " paren [character(4)] Opening closing parentheses two variants. Default: c("(", "[", ")", "]")

title: Convert Numeric to Factor, with custom formatting — cut_format

title: Exports to an environment — export
text: function wrapper around export.list() exports variables name another environment.

title: Exports to an environment — export
text: ... variables exported. target.env target environment.  Use global environment default.

title: Exports to an environment — export
text: Invisible NULL.

title: Exports to an environment — export
text: https://stackoverflow.com//17484932/946850

title: Exports to an environment — export
text: Roland

title: Exports to an environment — export
code: local({   newly.created.var <- 5   export(newly.created.var) }) newly.created.var #> [1] 5 rm(newly.created.var) #> Warning: object 'newly.created.var' not found

title: Exports to an environment — export.list
text: function wrapper around assign() exports contents named list environment.  variable names target environment constructed names list items taken separate argument.

title: Exports to an environment — export.list
text: arg.list list objects, possibly named. arg.names names use items target environment. Use names arg.list default. target.env target environment.  Use global environment default.

title: Exports to an environment — export.list
text: Invisible NULL.

title: Exports to an environment — export.list
text: https://stackoverflow.com//17484932/946850

title: Exports to an environment — export.list
text: Roland

title: Exports to an environment — export.list
code: export.list(list(newly.created.var = 5)) newly.created.var #> [1] 5 rm(newly.created.var) #> Warning: object 'newly.created.var' not found

title: Generalized lagged differences — gdiff
text: Returns suitably lagged iterated differences using arbitrary difference functions.

title: Generalized lagged differences — gdiff
text: x numeric vector matrix containing values     differenced. lag integer indicating lag use. differences integer indicating order difference. FUN distance function accepts two parameters ... arguments passed methods.

title: Generalized lagged differences — gdiff
text: x vector length n differences = 1, computed result equal successive differences FUN(x[(1+lag):n], x[1:(n-lag)]). difference larger one algorithm applied recursively x. Note returned value vector shorter x. x matrix difference operations carried column separately.

what: Converts a time value given in H:M:S format to the number of seconds since midnight — hms.to.seconds-deprecated
title: Converts a time value given in H:M:S format to the number of seconds since midnight — hms.to.seconds-deprecated
text: function similar strptime %X conversion specification. Anything three numbers two colons interpreted time, consistency check performed actual hour, minute second values. Thus, strings like 25:15:00 23:78:101 also converted. Incorrectly formatted strings converted NA warning.

title: Converts a time value given in H:M:S format to the number of seconds since midnight — hms.to.seconds-deprecated
Converts a time value given in H:M:S format to the number of seconds since midnight — hms.to.seconds-deprecated
text: x (vector ) strings H:M:S format.

title: Converts a time value given in H:M:S format to the number of seconds since midnight — hms.to.seconds-deprecated
text: (vector ) integer values length x.

title: Converts a time value given in H:M:S format to the number of seconds since midnight — hms.to.seconds-deprecated
code: hms.to.seconds(c("00:00:01", "00:01:00", "01:00:00")) #> `hms.to.seconds()` is deprecated, use `hms::parse_hms()` instead. #> [1]    1   60 3600 hms.to.seconds(c("25:15:00", "23:78:101")) #> [1] 90900 87581 hms.to.seconds("invalid") #> Warning: NAs introduced by coercion #> [1] NA

title: Order-preserving factors — ofactor-deprecated
text: factor. See base::factor() details.

title: Order-preserving factors — ofactor-deprecated
code: ofactor(3:1) #> `ofactor()` is deprecated, use `forcats::fct_inorder()` instead. #> [1] 3 2 1 #> Levels: 3 2 1 ofactor(9:12, exclude = 11) #> [1] 9    10   <NA> 12   #> Levels: 9 10 12 identical(ofactor(3:1, levels = 1:3), factor(3:1)) #> [1] TRUE

title: Random Samples and Permutations for Data Frames — sample.rows-deprecated
text: x data frame. size non-negative integer giving number items choose. replace sampling replacement? prob vector probability weights obtaining rows data frame sampled.

text: data frame shape x.

title: Random Samples and Permutations for Data Frames — sample.rows-deprecated
text: function internally calls sample.int().

title: Random Samples and Permutations for Data Frames — sample.rows-deprecated
code: set.seed(42) sample.rows(   data.frame(a = c(1, 2, 3), b = c(4, 5, 6), row.names = c("a", "b", "c")),   10,   replace = TRUE ) #> `sample.rows()` is deprecated, use `dplyr::sample_n()` instead. #>     a b #> a   1 4 #> a.1 1 4 #> a.2 1 4 #> a.3 1 4 #> b   2 5 #> b.1 2 5 #> b.2 2 5 #> a.4 1 4 #> c   3 6 #> c.1 3 6

title: kimisc 0.99.99.9900 (2024-11-30)
text: Upkeep (#14, #16). Relicense MIT (#14, #16).

title: kimisc 0.4 (2017-12-17)
text: CRAN release: 2017-12-18 coalesce.na(): dplyr::coalesce() hms..seconds() seconds..hms(): hms package list..df(), df..list(), nlist() nc(): tibble package ofactor(): forcats::fct_inorder() sample.data.frame(): dplyr::sample_n() thisfile() others: rprojroot package tll(): purrr::transpose() vswitch(): dplyr::recode() Unexported setMissingNames() Remove call test_examples() tests (#12, @jimhester).

title: Version 0.3 (2016-02-12)
text: CRAN release: 2016-02-14 examples. Throws error breaks atomic value. New list_to_df() df_to_list(). New vectorized switch function vswitch. Export helper functions used thisfile(). gdiff() attempt maintain class information, called function supposed . gdiff() accepts factor input. Determine knitr input via knitr::current_input() (#6). Use AppVeyor (checks Windows), Coveralls (coverage analysis) lintr (static code analysis). Fix CRAN checks.

title: Version 0.2-1 (2014-04-02)
text: CRAN release: 2014-04-02 Function ofactor now uses ... instead explicit argument list (making compatible R 2.15.3 future versions R), accepts levels argument (works like factor )

title: Version 0.2 (2014-03-20)
text: CRAN release: 2014-03-20 Cleanup CRAN release

title: Version 0.1.7
text: New function thisfile: Returns guess path currently executed script Removed dependencies Rcpp

title: Version 0.1.6
text: Removed useless Rcpp “Hello World” code New function ofactor: Creates factor maintains order levels data

title: Version 0.1.5
text: Remove functions tc tlist, ’re now part sweetnR package New function tll: Transposes list lists

title: Version 0.1.4
text: sample.rows hms..seconds seconds..hms in_interval nlist coalesce.na export
